errors.error_description: The path specified for the Google Fonts API key file, `/etc/gftools/api.key`, is incorrect and will not be found by the tools. This path also typically requires root permissions to write to.
correction_candidates: You will then need to create a new text file located on your system at ~/.gftools/api_key
You will then need to create a new text file located on your system at `~/.gf-api-key` (where ~ is your home directory)
You will then need to create a new text file located on your system at /var/lib/gftools/api.key
You will then need to export an environment variable GF_API_KEY with your key.
errors.golden_answer: You will then need to create a new text file located on your system at `~/.gf-api-key` (where ~ is your home directory)

errors.error_description: The instructions advise installing `gftools` globally with pip before creating and activating a virtual environment. This is the wrong order and defeats the purpose of using a virtual environment.
correction_candidates:
Use pipx to install gftools in an isolated environment:
pipx install gftools

Install the package and then create a venv with access to system packages:
pip install gftools
python3 -m venv gftools-venv --system-site-packages

First, create and activate a virtual environment, then install the package:
python3 -m venv gftools-venv
source gftools-venv/bin/activate
pip install gftools

Install the package directly with sudo:
sudo pip install gftools
errors.golden_answer:
First, create and activate a virtual environment, then install the package:
python3 -m venv gftools-venv
source gftools-venv/bin/activate
pip install gftools
